I am new to Cantera and I have couple questions. I am trying to 
model cata=
lytic combustion of methanol+hydrogen mixture as a 
nonisothermal tubular r=
eactor with catlayst distributed uniformly 
along the length of the reactor=
. I would like to see the temperature 
profile, concentration of gas and su=
rface species along the length 
of the reactor.

As a starting point I used=
 the catalytic combustion of methane 
described in Cantera's demos. If I un=
derstand the example correctly, 
gas reactions occur between the inlet and =
Pt surface (homogeneous 
chemistry), surface reactions only at Pt surface w=
hich is the last 
point of the grid (heterogeneous chemistry). Basically, t=
he surface 
reactions are modeled as a zero-dimensional reactor with surfac=
e 
chemistry. Do I understand it correctly? 

I wonder if and how I can use=
 the class 'Reactor' to incorporate 
catalyst weight and to get 2D matrix o=
f temperature distribution and 
gas + surface species. Does somebody have a=
n example that I could 
apply to my system? or does somebody have a suggest=
ion how to go 
about it so that I can utilize functions already incorporate=
d in 
Cantera?

Thank you,

Lucy
